reviewText:
I thought I stopped playing these types of games a long time ago. Hell, I thought they stopped MAKING these types of games a long time ago: A FUN SHOOTER.

But here I am at 3 and a half in the morning, forcing myself to go to bed because my aim has deteriorated. I want to play more, but the body is weak.

This is not COD. This is not Battlefield. The team that communicates best wins. This is a fast-paced tactical shooter. You need tactics to survive, let alone win. The cover system is servicable; it takes a bit to get used to, but you are rewarded for using cover with better aim and damage mitigation. That's important to note, because if you hate run and gunners as much as I do this is a beautiful thing. Gone are the risky behaviors getting rewarded. If you don't use cover and just run around, you're gonna get spanked, even at lower levels.

That said the game becomes a constest of which can hold and gain ground the best. And that's why you have to communicate. Voice comms are built in, ALT key by default. I didn't have to set up anything.

The F2P model is well done here. You can buy ALL WEAPONS with in game currency, the cash is saved for getting your unlocks early or buying cosmetics. There are XP boosts and such, but really this is a game of skill. You can drop cash on the best sniper rifle if you want to, but your'e gonna look real dumb dropping it on the ground repeatedly as new players oneshot you with the default sniper.

This is a solid game. I don't usually praise Clancy's work, especially the video game titles. But this game has that 'it' factor that leaves you wondering how in the hell you're going to survive the coming day with 2 hours of sleep.

It's a GOOD, Free squad tactics shooter with a very solid engine, well thought out HUD, and the fast pace you've come to love from modern shooters. I was meh about it when I saw the video, but the short learning curve and action drew me in.

While this game has a lot of potensial, especially since it came a long way since it's closed beta and open beta. First of all, let's get something out of the way. It is not a Pay to Win type of game, seriously it is getting ridicoulous how people call this a Pay To Win game, that is simply not true. A lot of the gear I have which I have not payed a cent at all in this game (I am considering to do so to support them) and yet, I have no problems taking down those pay2win players. All the gear I own that are free is more then enough to take them down. What really matters is team work in this game. the controls are fluent and easy to learn as well the cover system works very well.

Now, as one of the original beta testers in the game, one problem still persist and I have warned them about this multiple times over and over again, they REALLY need to work on optimizing the game. Seriously, my proccessor is above the minimum requirement version that you need to run the game and the audio lags incredibly bad. If this were to be fixed sooner, then it should be a hell of a lot more tolerable.

While the PvP is great and all, this game needs a PvE sessions where the story could be fleshed out more, maybe have the enemy's gear be equal to yours to be a challenge? That is a start for them to get something going. While the story is there, it is barely fleshed out. Sometimes I wonder what am I fighting for in the game.

To sum it all up: If you like a tactical shooter with a challenge, this should be something for you to try, however, that is IF you have the computer to handle it.

But here I am at 3 and a half in the morning, forcing myself to go to bed because my aim has deteriorated. I want to play more, but the body is weak.

This is not COD. This is not Battlefield. The team that communicates best wins. This is a fast-paced tactical shooter. You need tactics to survive, let alone win. The cover system is servicable; it takes a bit to get used to, but you are rewarded for using cover with better aim and damage mitigation. That's important to note, because if you hate run and gunners as much as I do this is a beautiful thing. Gone are the risky behaviors getting rewarded. If you don't use cover and just run around, you're gonna get spanked, even at lower levels.

That said the game becomes a constest of which can hold and gain ground the best. And that's why you have to communicate. Voice comms are built in, ALT key by default. I didn't have to set up anything.

The F2P model is well done here. You can buy ALL WEAPONS with in game currency, the cash is saved for getting your unlocks early or buying cosmetics. There are XP boosts and such, but really this is a game of skill. You can drop cash on the best sniper rifle if you want to, but your'e gonna look real dumb dropping it on the ground repeatedly as new players oneshot you with the default sniper.

This is a solid game. I don't usually praise Clancy's work, especially the video game titles. But this game has that 'it' factor that leaves you wondering how in the hell you're going to survive the coming day with 2 hours of sleep.

It's a GOOD, Free squad tactics shooter with a very solid engine, well thought out HUD, and the fast pace you've come to love from modern shooters. I was meh about it when I saw the video, but the short learning curve and action drew me in.

reviewText:
If you have played any of the more recent Ghost Recon games, ie Future Soldier, this game is right on track with that.  This being said, if you are new to Ghost Recon or its been a while since you last played, Phantoms is a third person, cover based, tactical shooter.  Running and gunning is an ill advised tactic, while not techincally impossible it will usually end with you dead before you can even pull the trigger.  While the game is free to play, there is an option to pay for gear with real money.  Now while it is not necessary to spend a single cent on the game for the main gear and weapons you will need, all items that change your looks will usually cost you some money, but like I said it is very optional and very pricey.

Here's a quick run down of the pros and cons:
Pros:
Firmilar game play
Lots of gun customization and selection
Great maps and game types
Leveling system is well laidout for all three classes
Cover system is almost perfect
In game voice coms

Cons:
Expensive market
Minor glitches
Only 2 game types

This the future of Ghost Recon for now and it seems to be holding its own against its predicessors. If you are a Tom Clancy fan at all this game is a must.

reviewText:
I've played many shooters, and this has to be one of the most enjoyable. Ghost Recon has the most interesting perception of the whole 'futuristic' scene from what ive seen. nothing like this CoD: Advanced Warfare crap.

One thing not many online shooters do that i was very pleased to see in this game, was how new players are pitted against other new players for a period of time, until they have the experience and the gear to go out into the full community, with some new maps as well.

My favorite part has to be the weapon customization. this is perfect for those that like a certain role, but want to play at different distances than intended. For example, i enjoy the mid-range assault class, but have my gun modified for a designated marksman role, so i can keep my distance like a sniper, but have a faster fire rate and heavier armor than one.

This game has one of the biggest tactical teamwork aspects that ive seen. not only is it a huge part, it is done well. Your team must communicate so everyone knows what dangers lie ahead, where and where not to go. Each classes special abilities can work in harmony to take down the enemy. The recon class can scan for enemies or go invisible, to infiltrate and report back so the assault classes can rush forward, and with the support class providing suppressing fire to ensure a successful operation.

The only problem i see is that it is too hard to get money, and if you blow it all as a beginner, you wont be able to afford better weapons by the time you level up and have to play with the pros. You cant get money because you cant win, you cant win because you cant kill, and you cant kill because you cant get money. BE VERY CAREFUL WITH MONEY

Either way, this is by far one of the most enjoyable games i've played. 9/10
